meanings.definition: Having a loud, deep, resonant sound.
meanings.sent1: The thunder was boomier than the rain.
meanings.sent2: The concert speaker was boomier than the small radio.
meanings.sent3: The boomier sound of the drum made everyone dance.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the room, boomier than usual.
meanings.sent5: The boomier roar of the lion sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.sent1: The boomier plant in the garden needed more space to grow.
meanings.sent2: The city's population became boomier with each passing year.
meanings.sent3: The boomier sales of the new product surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her hair seemed to be growing boomier by the day.
meanings.sent5: The boomier economy brought new opportunities for everyone.

meanings.definition: More booming in sound or growth than something else.
meanings.sent1: The boomier fireworks display outshone the others.
meanings.sent2: The boomier tree in the forest stood taller than the rest.
meanings.sent3: The boomier cake at the party was gone in minutes.
meanings.sent4: His voice was boomier than the microphone could handle.
meanings.sent5: The boomier athlete broke the previous record with ease.
